availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Simmons (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of J. Simmons and Jane Simmons. Married to Paralee Williams Simmons on September 8, 1855. Father of John M. Simmons, Lenora Simmons, Ida Simmons, and Mattie Simmons. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 362. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 165. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 27. Jordan Dodd, comp., Kentucky Marriages, 1851-1900, Ancestry, Todd County, 1855. _Find A Grave, "John C. Simmons (1828-1905)," Memorial #78061634, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=78061634 (accessed June 22, 2017).
